citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live animals.
citations.narrative:
3.137a(1)
On Feb. 16, 2023, while transporting two reindeer from Midway, UT, the side trailer door of a Featherlite livestock trailer
opened while in transit, allowing the two reindeer inside to exit the trailer in Orem, UT and become struck by a vehicle.
The licensee had loaded the animals at the exhibition site and stopped prior to exiting the event parking lot to walk around
the trailer to confirm all doors were closed and latched. After approximately twenty-five miles of both interstate and
surface street travel, the driver was alerted by a fellow motorist to the open side door and that the reindeer had jumped
out several blocks back. The licensee noted the livestock trailer was borrowed and in good working order, and no
damaged or broken parts were observed on the door. One reindeer, Jingle, was dead at the scene of the accident. The
second reindeer, Peppermint, died approximately one week later despite intensive veterinary care.
Any trailer used to transport the animals must withstand the normal rigors of transportation and contain the animals and
protect them from harm and injury. To be corrected from 5/5/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
